@Nofish: That reminds me of another use case. How practical  would it be to sign the page content with a BTC hardware wallet?

@Nofish: Yes, it would be cool. On the other hand, verifying the content on the trezor wouldn't be really practical. All you would gain is to make sure when a new version of the zite is released. You still need to trust the device that runs ZeroNet.

freedombone looks interesting. The only small device image they provide is for Beaglebone. Do I really have to rip my old KNC Miner apart?

@Binchan: On the freedombox website, they talk about mesh networking only as a future plan. What I would really like is something like the [mesh potato](https://store.villagetelco.com/mesh-potatoes.html) that is compatible to any other mesh network, and where any computer or phone can connect to without any problem or complicated configuration.
